clusters.title: News Wrap: Zelenskyy marks Ukraine’s Independence Day with ceremonies in Kyiv
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine Celebrates Independence Amid Ongoing War

items.title: News Wrap: Zelenskyy marks Ukraine’s Independence Day with ceremonies in Kyiv
items.standfirst: In our news wrap Sunday, Ukraine marked 34 years since declaring independence even as its war to repel Russian invaders stretches on, desperation to reach food aid is hitting a new high in Gaza, Israel struck targets in Yemen in retaliation for Houthi attacks, the Pentagon is reportedly planning…
items.content: In our news wrap Sunday, Ukraine marked 34 years since declaring independence even as its war to repel Russian invaders stretches on, desperation to reach food aid is hitting a new high in Gaza, Israel struck targets in Yemen in retaliation for Houthi attacks, the Pentagon is reportedly planning…

items.title: Ukraine marks Independence Day as Vance says Russia has made " significant concessions"
items.standfirst: Russia accused Ukraine of launching drone attacks that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant in its western Kursk region overnight Sunday.
items.content: Russia accused Ukraine of launching drone attacks that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant in its western Kursk region overnight Sunday.

items.title: 'Low key atmosphere' as Ukraine celebrates independence day
items.standfirst: Ukraine launched a wave of drone strikes on Russia Sunday, triggering a fire at a nuclear power plant as it celebrated Ukrainian independence day against a backdrop of fading hopes for recent peace efforts. The celebrations in Kyiv were "low key", FRANCE 24 correspondent Gulliver Cragg reported, as "large gatherings of people is still a security risk".
items.content: Ukraine launched a wave of drone strikes on Russia Sunday, triggering a fire at a nuclear power plant as it celebrated Ukrainian independence day against a backdrop of fading hopes for recent peace efforts. The celebrations in Kyiv were "low key", FRANCE 24 correspondent Gulliver Cragg reported, as "large gatherings of people is still a security risk".

items.title: As Ukraine marks Independence Day, Moscow says Kyiv struck a nuclear power plant in Russia
items.standfirst: Russia accused Ukraine on Sunday of launching drone attacks that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant in its western Kursk region overnight, as Ukraine celebrated 34 years since its independence.
items.content: Russia accused Ukraine on Sunday of launching drone attacks that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant in its western Kursk region overnight, as Ukraine celebrated 34 years since its independence.

items.title: Zelensky vows to continue fighting as Ukraine marks independence day
items.standfirst: Russia said power and energy facilities had been targeted by Ukraine, which accused Russia of "spreading manipulations".
items.content: Russia said power and energy facilities had been targeted by Ukraine, which accused Russia of "spreading manipulations".

items.title: Russian Nuclear Power Plant Damaged In Ukrainian Drone Attack, IAEA Monitors Radiation
items.standfirst: Russian Nuclear Power Plant Damaged In Ukrainian Drone Attack, IAEA Monitors Radiation In another dangerous escalation, Russia has accused Ukraine of launching a drone strike on the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, which sparked a fire and damaged an auxiliary transformer, resulting in a 50% reduction…
items.content: Russian Nuclear Power Plant Damaged In Ukrainian Drone Attack, IAEA Monitors Radiation In another dangerous escalation, Russia has accused Ukraine of launching a drone strike on the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, which sparked a fire and damaged an auxiliary transformer, resulting in a 50% reduction…

items.title: Russia accuses Ukraine of strike on nuclear plant in wave of drone attacks
items.standfirst: Moscow says operating capacity of reactor at Kursk site reduced by 50% as Kyiv celebrates independence dayMoscow has accused Kyiv of launching dozens of drone attacks, including one that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant, as Ukrainians marked 34 years since the country gained independence from the Soviet Union.The drone attack on the Kursk nuclear power plant in western Russia, 37 miles (60km) from the border with Ukraine, caused damage to an auxiliary transformer and forced a 50% reduction in the operating capacity of a reactor, Russian authorities said. Ukraine did not immediately comment on the alleged attack. Continue reading...
items.content: Moscow says operating capacity of reactor at Kursk site reduced by 50% as Kyiv celebrates independence dayMoscow has accused Kyiv of launching dozens of drone attacks, including one that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant, as Ukrainians marked 34 years since the country gained independence from the Soviet Union.The drone attack on the Kursk nuclear power plant in western Russia, 37 miles (60km) from the border with Ukraine, caused damage to an auxiliary transformer and forced a 50% reduction in the operating capacity of a reactor, Russian authorities said. Ukraine did not immediately comment on the alleged attack. Continue reading...

items.title: Canadian PM Carney attends celebrations on 34th Ukrainian Independence day
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Ukrainians should have no doubt about Canada's commitment to their country, as he delivered a speech in Sophia Square during a surprise visit to Kyiv. Carney's first visit to Ukraine came on the invitation of President Volodymyr Zelenskyyto mark Ukraine's 34th Independence Day.
items.content: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Ukrainians should have no doubt about Canada's commitment to their country, as he delivered a speech in Sophia Square during a surprise visit to Kyiv. Carney's first visit to Ukraine came on the invitation of President Volodymyr Zelenskyyto mark Ukraine's 34th Independence Day.

items.title: Zelenskyy marks Ukraine Independence Day alongside Canada’s PM in Kyiv
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivered a defiant address against Russia during Ukraine’s Independence Day.
items.content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivered a defiant address against Russia during Ukraine’s Independence Day.

items.title: Russia accuses Ukraine of attacking nuclear plant, causing a fire
items.standfirst: No increase in radiation levels detected after drone strikes, Russian officials say on Ukraine's Independence Day.
items.content: No increase in radiation levels detected after drone strikes, Russian officials say on Ukraine's Independence Day.

items.title: Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day amid the ongoing war with Russia
items.standfirst: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. France24 welcomes Tetyana Ogarkova, Journalist at Ukraine Crisis Media Center from Kyiv.
items.content: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. France24 welcomes Tetyana Ogarkova, Journalist at Ukraine Crisis Media Center from Kyiv.

items.title: Is Trump’s Ukraine gambit 'sending a signal to the world that America does not stand by its allies'?
items.standfirst: Ukraine launched a wave of drone strikes on Russia, triggering a fire at a nuclear power plant as it celebrated Ukrainian independence day against a backdrop of fading hopes for recent peace efforts.The brutal three-and-a-half-year war of attrition, which has killed tens of thousands of people, has ground to a virtual stalemate, though Russia has managed to eke out recent advances in the eastern Donetsk region. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, FRANCE 24's Catherine Viette is pleased to welcome Peter Zalmayev, Director of the Eurasian Democracy Initiative.
items.content: Ukraine launched a wave of drone strikes on Russia, triggering a fire at a nuclear power plant as it celebrated Ukrainian independence day against a backdrop of fading hopes for recent peace efforts.The brutal three-and-a-half-year war of attrition, which has killed tens of thousands of people, has ground to a virtual stalemate, though Russia has managed to eke out recent advances in the eastern Donetsk region. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, FRANCE 24's Catherine Viette is pleased to welcome Peter Zalmayev, Director of the Eurasian Democracy Initiative.

items.title: Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day from Soviet Union
items.standfirst: Ukraine is marking its 34th Independence Day this Sunday, commemorating its formal break from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. A day earlier, President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials observed National Flag Day, another key date in the country’s calendar. Ukrainians at home and abroad are preparing celebrations in dozens of countries, featuring concerts, marches, prayers, and charity events. France 24’s Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.
items.content: Ukraine is marking its 34th Independence Day this Sunday, commemorating its formal break from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. A day earlier, President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials observed National Flag Day, another key date in the country’s calendar. Ukrainians at home and abroad are preparing celebrations in dozens of countries, featuring concerts, marches, prayers, and charity events. France 24’s Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.

items.title: Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day from Soviet Union, after National Flag Day
items.standfirst: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. Charlotte Hughes has the details.
items.content: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. Charlotte Hughes has the details.

ai_summary: Ukraine marked 34 years of independence while fighting Russian invaders.
Russia accused Ukraine of drone attacks on a nuclear power plant.
Celebrations in Kyiv were low-key due to security concerns.
IAEA monitors radiation after the alleged drone strike on the plant.
Zelensky vowed to continue fighting as the war continues.

items.title: Wildfires in California and Oregon grow, prompting evacuations and warnings
items.standfirst: Firefighters battle blazes amid dry, hot weather as fires in Napa county and Deschutes and Jefferson counties spreadWildfires in California wine country and central Oregon grew overnight, prompting hundreds of evacuations as firefighters worked on Sunday to try to contain the blazes amid dry, hot weather.The Pickett Fire in Napa county had grown to more than 10 sq miles (26 sq km) and was 11% contained as of early Sunday, according to the California Department of Forestry & Fire Protection. Continue reading...

items.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia expects to be detained by ICE again, attorney says

items.title: Trump administration plans to deport newly freed Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda
items.standfirst: The US government is seeking to deport El Salvadoran national Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully expelled from the US in March before returning to face detention in the US, to Uganda, his defence attorneys said Saturday. Abrego Garcia reportedly declined a plea deal that would see him deported to Costa Rica.
items.content: The US government is seeking to deport El Salvadoran national Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully expelled from the US in March before returning to face detention in the US, to Uganda, his defence attorneys said Saturday. items.title: France summons US ambassador Charles Kushner over antisemitism allegations
items.standfirst: Kushner says in letter to Macron he’s concerned over ‘rise of antisemitism’ and ‘lack of sufficient action’ to confront itFrance summoned the American ambassador Charles Kushner after he wrote a letter to President Emmanuel Macron alleging France had failed to do enough to stem antisemitic violence, a French foreign ministry spokesperson said on Sunday.Kushner, who is Jewish and whose son is married to U.S President Donald Trump’s daughter, published the open letter in the Wall Street Journal amid deep divides between France and the US and Israel. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Family of man who died at North Tyneside fairground describe their ‘impossible’ pain
items.standfirst: Corrie Lee Stavers remembered as a ‘much loved colleague’ at Spanish City Summer Funfair, which shut for weekendThe family of Corrie Lee Stavers, who has died while working on a fairground ride in North Tyneside, have issued a statement describing the “impossible” pain of their loss.Stavers, 28, suffered “serious head injuries” in what Northumbria police described as a “workplace accident” at the Spanish City Summer Funfair in Whitley Bay on Saturday afternoon. Continue reading...
items.content: Corrie Lee Stavers remembered as a ‘much loved colleague’ at Spanish City Summer Funfair, which shut for weekendThe family of Corrie Lee Stavers, who has died while working on a fairground ride in North Tyneside, have issued a statement describing the “impossible” pain of their loss.Stavers, 28, suffered “serious head injuries” in what Northumbria police described as a “workplace accident” at the Spanish City Summer Funfair in Whitley Bay on Saturday afternoon. Continue reading...

items.title: Worker who died at funfair 'will be loved endlessly'
items.standfirst: Corrie Lee Stavers, 28, suffered fatal head injuries at a funfair on Saturday afternoon, police say.
items.content: Corrie Lee Stavers, 28, suffered fatal head injuries at a funfair on Saturday afternoon, police say.

ai_summary: Corrie Lee Stavers died at a fairground.
He suffered serious head injuries in a workplace accident.
The fairground shut for the weekend.
His family described their pain.
He was a much-loved colleague.

clusters.title: European Postal Services Suspend Shipment of Packages to US Over Tariffs
clusters.neutral_headline: European Postal Services Suspend Shipment of Packages to US Over Tariffs

items.title: European Postal Services Suspend Shipment of Packages to US Over Tariffs
items.standfirst: Many European shipping companies say they’re unable to guarantee shipments will arrive before the new rules are in place on Aug. 29.
items.content: Many European shipping companies say they’re unable to guarantee shipments will arrive before the new rules are in place on Aug. 29.

items.title: Boxed in by shifting tariff rules, European shippers pause some U.S.-bound parcels
items.standfirst: New customs regulations take effect August 29, and many European postal agencies and companies say until new systems are set up they can't ship some goods. Gifts worth less than $100 are not affected.
items.content: New customs regulations take effect August 29, and many European postal agencies and companies say until new systems are set up they can't ship some goods. Gifts worth less than $100 are not affected.(Image credit: Nicolas Guyannet/Hans Lucas)

ai_summary: European shipping companies are suspending shipments to the US.
New customs rules take effect on August 29.
Many companies cannot guarantee arrival before the rules.
Gifts worth less than $100 are not affected.
European postal agencies are pausing some US-bound parcels.

clusters.title: Bands pull out from festival after group 'cut off' over flag
clusters.neutral_headline: Bands Boycott Festival After Group's Set Allegedly Cut

items.title: Bands pull out from festival after group 'cut off' over flag
items.standfirst: Several bands have pulled out from the Victorious music festival just hours before their scheduled performances, following claims by Irish folk group The Mary Wallopers that they were "cut off" for displaying a Palestinian flag.
items.content: Several bands have pulled out from the Victorious music festival just hours before their scheduled performances, following claims by Irish folk group The Mary Wallopers that they were "cut off" for displaying a Palestinian flag.

items.title: Bands boycott music festival after group's set 'cut off'
items.standfirst: The Last Dinner Party, Cliffords and The Academic refuse to perform at Victorious Festival.
items.content: The Last Dinner Party, Cliffords and The Academic refuse to perform at Victorious Festival.

ai_summary: Several bands withdrew from Victorious music festival before performances.
The Mary Wallopers claimed they were "cut off" for displaying a Palestinian flag.
The Last Dinner Party, Cliffords, and The Academic refused to perform.
The festival's actions prompted the bands to boycott the event.
The incident sparked controversy regarding artistic expression and censorship.

clusters.title: Anti-refugee protesters in the UK rally against hotels for asylum seekers
clusters.neutral_headline: Protests Erupt Over Hotels Housing Asylum Seekers in UK

items.title: Anti-refugee protesters in the UK rally against hotels for asylum seekers
items.standfirst: Far-right protesters and anti-racism campaigners have faced off at rallies across the UK against hotels housing asylum
items.content: Far-right protesters and anti-racism campaigners have faced off at rallies across the UK against hotels housing asylum

items.title: Anti-immigrant protesters and counter-protesters face off across UK
items.standfirst: Protests against the use of hotels to house asylum seekers took place across the UK, with demonstrators gathering in cities such as Bristol, Liverpool, and London, as well as in Mold, Perth, and County Antrim. In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Former British Minister of European Affairs, Denis MacShane, speaks to France24 for further explanations.
items.content: Protests against the use of hotels to house asylum seekers took place across the UK, with demonstrators gathering in cities such as Bristol, Liverpool, and London, as well as in Mold, Perth, and County Antrim. In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Former British Minister of European Affairs, Denis MacShane, speaks to France24 for further explanations.

items.title: Asylum hotel protesters met by counter-demonstrators across UK
items.standfirst: Protests against the use of hotels to house asylum seekers took place across the UK, with demonstrators gathering in cities such as Bristol, Liverpool, and London, as well as in Mold, Perth, and County Antrim. In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Simon Moritz and Ethan Hajji tell us more.
items.content: Protests against the use of hotels to house asylum seekers took place across the UK, with demonstrators gathering in cities such as Bristol, Liverpool, and London, as well as in Mold, Perth, and County Antrim. In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Simon Moritz and Ethan Hajji tell us more.

items.title: Protests against hotel housing asylum seekers take place across the UK
items.standfirst: Protesters took to the streets in towns and cities across the United Kingdom on Saturday to demonstrate against hotels housing asylum-seekers. Counter-demonstrations were also held in Bristol and Liverpool, where police intervened to keep rival groups apart.
items.content: Protesters took to the streets in towns and cities across the United Kingdom on Saturday to demonstrate against hotels housing asylum-seekers. Counter-demonstrations were also held in Bristol and Liverpool, where police intervened to keep rival groups apart.

ai_summary: Anti-refugee protests and counter-demonstrations occurred across the UK.
Protests took place in cities including Bristol, Liverpool, and London.
Police intervened to separate rival groups in several locations.
The unrest followed a High Court ruling blocking asylum accommodation plans.
Former British Minister of European Affairs, Denis MacShane, offered explanations.

clusters.title: Ghislaine Maxwell was given 'platform to rewrite history', say Virginia Giuffre's family
clusters.neutral_headline: Ghislaine Maxwell Interview Sparks Controversy, Denials

items.title: Ghislaine Maxwell was given 'platform to rewrite history', say Virginia Giuffre's family
items.standfirst: The family of Virginia Giuffre, who was one of Jeffrey Epstein's most prominent sex trafficking accusers, have said they are "outraged" over the US Department of Justice's release of an interview with Ghislaine Maxwell.
items.content: The family of Virginia Giuffre, who was one of Jeffrey Epstein's most prominent sex trafficking accusers, have said they are "outraged" over the US Department of Justice's release of an interview with Ghislaine Maxwell.

items.title: Ghislaine Maxwell denies seeing 'inappropriate' conduct by Trump
items.standfirst: Maxwell was interviewed after pressure on Trump to release information about whether prominent figures were involved in Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.
items.content: Maxwell was interviewed after pressure on Trump to release information about whether prominent figures were involved in Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.

ai_summary: Virginia Giuffre's family expressed outrage over the interview release.
The US Department of Justice released an interview with Ghislaine Maxwell.
Maxwell denied witnessing "inappropriate" conduct by Donald Trump.
The interview followed pressure to release information on Epstein's crimes.
The situation involves allegations of sex trafficking and high-profile figures.
